notes: Seed entries are extracted from high-confidence recurring signals in listed resources.
Price ranges are operational seed ranges and should be refreshed with periodic market scans.
Glossary entries are marked needs_native_review for linguistic QA before production use.
Includes curated extraction from Lonely Planet · Pocket Marrakesh 7 (PDF, 161 pages), processed on 2026-02-07.

items.title: Use app booking for taxis when possible
items.summary: Community guidance repeatedly recommends app-based taxi booking to reduce meter and fare disputes.
actions: Check app quote before entering taxi
Confirm destination pin before departure

items.title: Agafay is a rocky desert, not Sahara dunes
items.summary: Set expectations correctly: Agafay excels for quick sunset packages, not full dune isolation.
actions: Pick Agafay for half-day/evening plans
Choose Merzouga tours for dune-focused desert experience

items.title: Navigate medina with landmark waypoints
items.summary: Dense medina lanes are easier with major landmark checkpoints than turn-by-turn assumptions.
actions: Save Koutoubia and Jemaa as recovery waypoints
Use rooftop pause points for orientation reset

items.title: Confirm photo/performance fees before engaging
items.summary: In major squares, fee expectations can be ambiguous after photos or interactions.
actions: Ask the exact amount before accepting photo interaction
Politely decline unclear offers

items.title: Re-check monument access and hours
items.summary: Community and practical guidance indicate occasional schedule/access variability in heritage areas.
actions: Verify opening hours same-day for key monuments
Keep one backup nearby stop in itinerary

items.title: Travel with water-conscious habits
items.summary: Local context emphasizes water stress and encourages practical conservation by visitors.
actions: Limit towel/laundry churn in stays
Prefer shorter showers

items.title: Compare activities by inclusions, not headline price
items.summary: Cross-platform listings show similar titles with very different actual inclusions.
actions: Check transfer, meals, and duration before paying
Require final all-in price

items.title: Carry small cash denominations
items.summary: Small transactions in souks and street settings are easier with small bills and coins.
actions: Break larger notes in cafes/supermarkets early
Keep separate small-change pocket

items.title: Use rooftop break at sunset for reset
items.summary: Community and editorial narratives highlight rooftop sunset pauses as high-value low-stress moments.
actions: Plan a 30-45 min rooftop stop near Maghreb
Resume souk exploration after peak crowd shift

items.title: Choose busy street-food stalls with visible turnover
items.summary: Night market food is a highlight; stall turnover and clear handling can reduce risk.
actions: Prefer visibly busy stalls
Ask price before serving

items.title: Mix local staples with familiar food for kids
items.summary: Street-food snacks and classic dishes can work well for adventurous children, while pizza/pasta options are widely available for picky eaters.
actions: Start with simple options like plain couscous, harira or grilled sandwiches
Keep one familiar fallback meal option per day

items.title: Use grand taxis for larger families
items.summary: Petits taxis usually allow three passengers only, so families often need a grand taxi or alternate transport.
actions: Confirm passenger count before getting in
Use calèches or tuk tuk when children are tired and walking tolerance drops

items.title: Avoid pushchairs in the medina
items.summary: Dense lanes and uneven surfaces make strollers impractical in core medina routes.
actions: Use baby carrier, sling or lightweight child-carry setup
Plan shorter route segments with regular rest stops

items.title: Do souqs early for family comfort
items.summary: Early mornings are quieter in souq lanes, with less crowd pressure and better visibility of crafts.
actions: Enter souqs early and reserve afternoons for lower-density stops
Avoid peak midday crowd and heat windows

items.title: Family-friendly Djemaa window is around 18:00-20:00
items.summary: The early evening window captures dance/music atmosphere while avoiding a very late finish for children.
actions: Plan dinner and performance viewing before bedtime fatigue
Use rooftop viewpoints if the square becomes overwhelming

items.title: Marrakesh accommodation baseline is riad-heavy in the medina
items.summary: Core city stays are dominated by traditional riad guesthouses across budget, midrange and high-end tiers.
actions: Choose medina riad when you want architecture and walkable souq access
Confirm room accessibility details before booking

items.title: Stay near Djemaa for nightlife and easy evening access
items.summary: Djemaa and southern central souqs give strong evening energy and broad accommodation coverage across price levels.
actions: Prioritize this zone if night square access matters most
Check for sound insulation if you are a light sleeper

items.title: Stay in Mouassine for shopping and museum density
items.summary: Mouassine/Central Souqs offers high shopping density, growing design presence and multiple museums.
actions: Choose this area when souq access is your top priority
Expect heavier foot traffic versus quieter medina edges

items.title: Kasbah/Mellah works for palace-first itineraries
items.summary: Kasbah and Mellah are close to major historic sights and generally calmer at night than core souq zones.
actions: Pick this zone for Bahia/Badi/Saadian-heavy days
Use evening transport planning if nightlife focus is in Djemaa

items.title: Bab Doukkala is a balanced base with residential feel
items.summary: Bab Doukkala/Riad Laarous combines quieter residential rhythm with good restaurant and activity access.
actions: Use this base for longer stays that mix medina and workshop/yoga/cycling activities
Plan daily transit for deep Kasbah or Gueliz priorities

items.title: Agafay lodges are best as a short add-on, not medina replacement
items.summary: Agafay offers luxury camp-style stays with sunset entertainment about 45 minutes from Marrakech.
actions: Use Agafay for one-night contrast after city days
Confirm transport plan to and from medina before booking

items.title: Quick nightly accommodation ladder
items.summary: Typical ranges noted in the guide: hostel dorm from EUR16, boutique midrange riad around EUR100+, and top luxury riads around EUR300+.
actions: Use this as pre-booking budget guardrail before comparing properties
Expect event dates and holidays to push top-end rates upward

items.title: Travel insurance is essential because treatment is usually paid upfront
items.summary: Emergency care commonly requires immediate payment, so strong travel insurance is a baseline requirement.
actions: Carry policy details and emergency contact numbers offline
Include theft, delay and luggage loss coverage where possible

items.title: Prefer bottled water if your system is sensitive
items.summary: Tap water in major cities is generally considered safe by local standards, but many visitors do better with bottled water.
actions: Use sealed bottled water for hydration if unsure
Avoid unlabeled tap-water glasses in cafes if you are sensitive

items.title: Use cross-body bags in dense lanes
items.summary: Bag snatching by passing riders can occur in busy medina routes.
actions: Wear bags cross-body and zipped
Avoid exposing phones and wallets near street edges

items.title: Protect against midday heat
items.summary: Summer midday heat can degrade safety and decision quality; hydrate and shift plans to cooler windows.
actions: Schedule high-effort walking in morning or late afternoon
Use shaded or indoor stops during peak heat

items.title: Avoid paid interactions that exploit animals
items.summary: Guidance flags snake charming and chained-monkey photo setups as practices to avoid supporting.
actions: Decline animal photo/handling offers
Walk away from handlers instead of negotiating

items.title: Support local cooperatives and training-led enterprises
items.summary: Choose locally run riads, women-led cooperatives and social enterprises to keep spending in community networks.
actions: Prioritize cooperatives and mission-led experiences when shopping/eating
Use operators with direct local training or employment impact

items.title: Shift timing to reduce overtourism pressure
items.summary: Early visits and smaller museums reduce crowd pressure on major heritage bottlenecks.
actions: Book major sights early in the day
Rotate at least one smaller museum into each monument-heavy day

items.title: Assume limited accessibility in old-medina routes
items.summary: Stair-heavy riads and medieval lanes can be difficult for mobility devices; pre-check every stop.
actions: Request exact access details from accommodation before booking
Use modern-hotel base when step-free movement is required

items.title: Majorelle and YSL are among the strongest accessible visits
items.summary: Guide highlights Jardin Majorelle and Musée Yves Saint Laurent as generally step-free with adapted facilities.
actions: Prioritize this pair for lower-friction cultural day planning
Use prebooked timed entries to reduce queue friction

items.title: LGBTIQ+ travelers should plan with legal and social discretion
items.summary: The guide notes conservative norms and legal risk around same-sex relationships, with discretion recommended in public settings.
actions: Use trusted accommodations and specialist resources where relevant
Keep public displays of affection low-profile regardless of orientation
